eiteam.esteemedinnovation.api.tile

Class TileEntityTickableSafe

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.minecraft.tileentity.TileEntity
      • eiteam.esteemedinnovation.api.tile.TileEntityBase
        • eiteam.esteemedinnovation.api.tile.TileEntityTickableSafe
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    net.minecraft.util.ITickable, net.minecraftforge.common.capabilities.ICapabilityProvider, net.minecraftforge.common.capabilities.ICapabilitySerializable<net.minecraft.nbt.NBTTagCompound>, net.minecraftforge.common.util.INBTSerializable<net.minecraft.nbt.NBTTagCompound>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SteamReactorTileEntity, SteamTransporterTileEntity

    public abstract class TileEntityTickableSafe
extends TileEntityBase
implements net.minecraft.util.ITickable
    Base TileEntity class that ensures that no tick code is executed when the block in its occupied position is not the expected one (usually, when this issue arises, it is air.)

    It implements ITickable, but children of this class should implement safeUpdate(), not update().

    This should only be necessary to use (as an alternative to TileEntityBase and ITickable explicitly) when you need to access block state values within the update code.

      • canUpdate

        public abstract boolean canUpdate(net.minecraft.block.state.IBlockState target)
        Parameters:
        target - The block state that is in the position of this tile entity.
        Returns:
        Whether we are safe to execute the ticking code for the provided block state.

      • safeUpdate

        public abstract void safeUpdate()
        A safe variant of ITickable.update(). It is only executed when canUpdate(IBlockState) is true.

      • initialUpdate

        public void initialUpdate()
        Like TileEntity.onLoad(), except that it is safe (see safeUpdate()) and happens after the world has loaded. onLoad() occurs during the world loading process, so you cannot access any blockstate values or anything of that sort. This is designed to be used for initialization stuff.

        This is called before safeUpdate() is called.

        You must either call the supermethod or setInitialized(boolean) in your implementation, or at some point during update or safeUpdate, otherwise this method will repeatedly get called.

        This is not necessarily the first update. Rather, it is the first update after the TE has been uninitialized. It just happens to also begin uninitialized. It truly is called whenever an update occurs and the TE is not initialized (see isInitialized()).

        For example, you might have a device that sets some value in the TE based on the block's facing value. The facing value probably won't change, so it doesn't make sense to retrieve that value every update. Using this, you would store the value once, and then simply use it in safeUpdate() when you need. However, if you had some custom behavior utilizing a PipeWrench that would rotate the block, you would need to reset that value in the TE. You can do that by having a proxy method in the TE that calls setInitialized(boolean) (since that method is protected for security reasons; more on that later) so that the next update resets the value in the TE.

        Here is a code sample for the scenario previously described: 

         
     // SomeTileEntity.java
     class SomeTileEntity extends TileEntityTickableSafe {
         private EnumFacing facing;

          @Override
         public void initialUpdate() {
             super.initialUpdate();
             facing = worldObj.getBlockState(pos).getValue(SomeBlock.FACING);
         }

          @Override
         public void safeUpdate() {
             // Destroys the block in the direction it is facing, for example.
             worldObj.destroyBlock(pos.offset(facing), true);
         }

         void uninitialize() {
             setInitialized(false);
         }
     }

     // SomeBlock.java, in same package
     class SomeBlock extends Block implements Wrenchable {
         static final PropertyDirection FACING = BlockDirectional.FACING;

         // IBlockState implementations

          @Override
         public boolean onWrench(ItemStack stack, EntityPlayer player, World world, BlockPos pos, EnumHand hand, EnumFacing facing, IBlockState state, float hitX, float hitY, float hitZ) {
             // Rotate the block
             world.setBlockState(pos, state.withProperty(FACING, state.getValue(FACING).rotateY()));
             TileEntity te = world.getTileEntity(pos);
             if (te instanceof SomeTileEntity) {
                 // Uninitialize the tile entity since our facing value has changed.
                 ((SomeTileEntity) te).uninitialize();
             }
         }
     }
